definition: to take a joint photo/group photo
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: The cast of the 40th season of "Sesame Street.
sentences.chinese: 《芝麻街》第40季的全体演职人员合影。

sentences.english: Many students go through the gate and take a photo with it.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生从“永不挂科门”中穿过，或合影留念。

sentences.english: This was the last arch stone bridge. We took a photo of team here.
sentences.chinese: 上山前最后一座石拱桥，在这里，我们集体合影留念。

sentences.english: Fu Kecheng, chairperson of Jiangxi Political Consultative Conference and Board chairman Zheng Yuanbao.
sentences.chinese: 江西省政协主席傅克诚与郑元豹董事长合影留念。

sentences.english: Sanxia Photo, Evidence of Our Love.
The first photo I took of my parents. They looked serious.
sentences.chinese: 这是我给爹娘拍的第一张合影，那时的爹娘一脸严肃。

sentences.english: I took this picture with the owners and executive producers for Shanghai Film Group and Television Production Company.
sentences.chinese: 这张是我和上影集团老板和制片人的合影。

sentences.english: Students and guests at the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 学员们和到场嘉宾在开学典礼上合影。

sentences.english: Obama and the rest of his homeroom class pose for a portrait for the 1979 school yearbook.
sentences.chinese: Obama和同班同学在1979年校鉴中的合影。

sentences.english: George Bernard Shaw is pictured with Lu Xun, the father of modern Chinese fiction, in 1933.
sentences.chinese: 有1933年萧伯纳和中国现代小说之父鲁迅合影。

sentences.english: At the end of the meeting, Wen took photos with each of the members.
sentences.chinese: 会见结束后，温家宝分别同每个医疗队员合影留念。

sentences.english: Steven and Bill want to have a picture together and they intend to go to a photo studio.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文和比尔想照张合影，他们打算去一家照相馆。

sentences.english: Yeye posed with the back the Statue of Liberty.
sentences.chinese: 和自由女神合影是必不可少的，哪怕是背影呢。

sentences.english: The photo shows Rogers with Mr. Jeffery Leng , Resident Manager of Sofitel Galaxy Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 图为罗杰斯与酒店驻店经理冷骏先生合影。

sentences.english: Oh, no. Rita, where's the photo of Philip and Ben?
sentences.chinese: 噢，天。丽塔，菲利普和本的合影在哪儿？

sentences.english: Ly Pao holds one of the group's children.
sentences.chinese: 鲍立抱着营寨中的一个孩子合影留念。

definition: to take a photo as a souvenir/a souvenir photo
to keep as a souvenir/to recall fondly
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
head-and-shoulders photo (esp. a formal one used in a passport, ID card etc)
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
